title: DJ Playlist: The Sounds of Ling Ling Mykonos
content:
Summer is still simmering in Greece, where diners at Ling Ling Mykonos enjoy Cantonese cuisine under the olive trees at the open-air restaurant in the heart of Mykonos’s old town. In the background, they may notice the subtle beats that pulsate from the speakers.

The man behind the music lineup is Pathaan, Ling Ling’s global music director and a celebrated DJ. Working as a passenger planner for United Airlines in the early ’90s, he moonlighted as a DJ on weekends. The gigs kept coming, and eventually he toured with David Bowie before going on his own in 1997. Two decades later, after a successful stint with BBC radio, he’s only broadened his musical interests. “I’m constantly listening to music, so I have various folders set up in which I’m forever adding tracks,” he says.

Each month, along with organizing the tunes for Ling Ling’s Mykonos, Marrakech, and (newly opened) Oslo locations, he also coordinates a Ling Ling playlist for Soho Radio. The London-based internet radio station has a wildly eclectic lineup of shows, from music to poetry sessions to discussions on film and cooking, a mix that earned it the title of World’s Best Internet Radio Station in the 2016 Online Radio Awards.

“What I love about ‘Ling Ling with Pathaan,’ is that it’s given me that radio bug, which allows me to showcase music on my radar to a wider audience beyond those people visiting our restaurants, and it allows the listener to become intrigued about Ling Ling as a brand,” he says. “Being part of that process creating that brand awareness super exciting.”

Discussing one of his recent playlists, Paathan describes the feel as “eclectic, fun electronica with a hint of guilty pleasure.” What does that mean? An international song list with tracks from the likes of Norwegian metal group Mork, (mostly) German trance band Talamanca System, and Spanish groovy underground artist James Rod.

“The show is an extension of the soundtrack I have curated in the Ling Ling restaurants,” says Paathan. “No matter how eclectic the music is, somehow it all intertwines together perfectly as an interesting entertaining listen.” And if you can’t hear it live (it’s broadcast the first Tuesday of every month, between 6-8pm GMT), listen to it in “any setting besides a dance party,” he says. “It’s a Tuesday show, so not quite perfect for dancing situation, but then again that’s suggestive…”

Here’s the full song list from Paathan’s recent Ling Ling with Paathan show:

  2. Khidja - Aura (In Flagranti Remix)

  3. Silent Riders - I See You (Whatever Whatever remix)

  4. Talamanca System - 104

  5. Ary - Higher

  6. Pete Herbert and Martin Denev - Time

  7. Mork - Disco in Odd Times

  8. Pulp Disco & The Outcasts - Journey Into The Bright World

  9. Fakear - Le Belle Ame

  10. Sezer Uysal - Wilderness

  11. Dolle Jolle - Balearic Incarnation

  12. Pablo Bolivar Sensual Physics - In Other Words

  13. The Beat Broker - After Touch

  14. Italo Brutalo - Spy In The Sky

  15. Man Power - Fisky

  16. Beans & Co. - The Go Go (Craig Bratley remix)

  17. Laroz Camel Rider -Jelamsoul feat. Riff Cohen

  18. James Rod - Night Stratus

  19. Autarkic - Rotation! Rotation! (Red Axes remix)

  20. YokoO & Retza - The Akashic Records
